name: JXA
description: JavaScript for Automation (JXA) support in Nova.

config.title: Linting
config.description: Whether and when automatic linting of open JXA files should be performed.

config.title: Hide extra linter information.
config.description: Linters will add an informative entry when they find issues. The exact contents of that entry depend on the active linter (ESLint or osacompile). Check this if you only want the reported issues displayed.

config.title: eslint binary path
config.description: Path to the eslint binary to use when linting. If this is unset, the extension will look for a project-local instance of the binary first, then for a global one. Only set this if you need to use a binary that will not be found in your $PATH.

configWorkspace.title: Linting
configWorkspace.description: Whether and when automatic linting of open JXA files should be performed.

configWorkspace.title: eslint binary path
configWorkspace.description: Path to the eslint binary to use when linting. If this is unset, the global setting is used. If that is unset too, the extension will look for a project-local instance of the binary first, then for a global one. Only set this if you need to use a binary that will not be found in your $PATH.

JXA Script Compilation.name: Compile JXA Script
JXA Script Compilation.description: Compiles the current JavaScript for Automation (JXA) source file to a binary JXA script.

config.title: Build directory
config.description: The directory where to put the compiled scripts, relative to the project root.

config.title: Output format settings
config.description: The following options dictate what kind of script will be created.

children.title: Script file format
children.description: The script format to compile to.

children.title: Save the resulting script as execute-only
children.description: Compile the script for execution only: the source code will not be available for editing in the compiled file.

config.title: Applet / Droplet settings
config.description: The following options are only relevant when creating a new bundled applet or droplet.

JXA Script Execution.name: Execute JXA script
JXA Script Execution.description: Execute the current JavaScript for Automation (JXA) source code.

config.title: Run selection
config.description: Run the code of the primary selection in the editor. If this is unset, or if this is set and no code is selected, the whole source file will be run.

config.title: Human readable output
config.description: Printing results in human-readable form means strings do not have quotes around them, characters are not escaped, brackets for arrays and braces for objects are omitted, etc. Apple consider this as “generally more useful”, but it can introduce ambiguities. To see the results in an unambiguous form that could be recompiled into the same value, switch this off.
